text: {{Infobox writer | image = Raymond Moody 1.jpg | imagesize = 200px | name = Raymond Moody | caption = | pseudonym = | birth_date = | birth_place = Porterdale, Georgia, United States | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Author, doctor of medicine | nationality = American | period = 20th century | genre = Philosophy | subject = Near-death experiences | movement = | influences = | influenced = | signature = | website = }} Raymond Moody (born June 30, 1944) is a psychologist and medical doctor. He has written books about near death experiences (NDEs), a term that he coined in 1975. His best-selling book is Life After Life. ==Related pages== *Bruce Greyson *Ian Stevenson *Parapsychology *Life Before Life Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:American psychiatrists Category:American psychologists
title: Raymond Moody
